function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of understanding of the hospitalization period (DH) and its impact on disease spread in the built environment","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment of disease propagation and ineffective mitigation strategies","Mitigation":"Conduct research to accurately estimate DH and its impact on disease spread, and incorporate this data into modeling and mitigation efforts","Technologies":"Medical data collection and analysis technologies, modeling and simulation tools","People":"Public health researchers, epidemiologists, and modeling experts","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Complex mathematical modeling approach may lead to errors in estimating the effective reproductive ratio (R_eff)","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment of disease spread and potential overestimation or underestimation of control measures","Mitigation":"Validate the mathematical model with real-world data and observations, and seek peer review from experts in epidemiology and mathematical modeling","Technologies":"Data analysis tools, statistical software, peer review platforms","People":"Mathematical modelers, epidemiologists, data analysts, and peer reviewers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Uncertainty in the estimation of the effective reproductive ratio (R_eff) due to complex model dynamics and parameters","Impact":"Ineffective implementation of control measures and policies based on unreliable R_eff estimates","Mitigation":"Conduct sensitivity analysis to understand the impact of parameter uncertainty on R_eff estimates, and communicate the uncertainty in R_eff to decision-makers","Technologies":"Sensitivity analysis tools, communication platforms","People":"Public health policymakers, decision-makers, and epidemiologists","Owner":"Public health organizations"}]}
